plugins.name: mucopy
plugins.description:
MuCopy: Revolutionize Your UX Writing with AI


Say goodbye to "Lorem Ipsum" and hello to MuCopy, the future of UX writing in Figma. Powered by GPT-4 and advanced language models, MuCopy is designed to transform the way you write and design user interfaces. Whether you're crafting tooltips, buttons, or entire dialogue boxes, MuCopy assists in generating concise, relevant, and engaging microcopy that fits perfectly into your designs.


Key Features:

  • AI-Driven Writing Assistant: Leverage the power of GPT-4 for generating creative, contextually relevant text.
  • Seamless Integration: Works within Figma, allowing you to write and edit copy directly on your designs.
  • Time-Saving: Say goodbye to writer's block and reduce the time spent on writing and editing copy.
  • Customizable: Tailor the suggestions to fit your brand voice and style guidelines.
  • Collaborative: Ideal for teams, ensuring consistent and effective communication across your designs.


Whether you're a UX writer, designer, or a team looking to streamline your design process, MuCopy is your go-to plugin for creating microcopy that resonates with users and elevates your designs.
plugins.tagline: Say bye 👋 to "Lorem ipsum" create micro(μ)copy that ships to production 💻

plugins.name: Sticky Status
plugins.description:
Status block for frames or components to assist in project status tracking and status note taking. This plugin allows you to add a block that is attached to your page/frame to allows you to set a status and leave comments/notes about the status.


The following statuses are supported currently:

  • Draft
  • In Progress
  • Ready for Review
  • Under Review
  • Approved
  • Ready for Development
  • Not Needed


NOTE: At this time, this plugin will not work with instances. Instances don't allow modification so the plugin is unable to add the status widget to the frame. In order to make this work, you can wrap your instance in a frame and then apply the status. You can add an auto-layout with all 0s for spacing and it will not impact the layout or design.
plugins.tagline: Sticky status blocks for frames and components.

plugins.name: Markly - Paste/Copy from Markdown
plugins.description:
Markly makes it effortless to bring Markdown into your Figma designs or export Figma text layers as Markdown. Paste or type Markdown to instantly create styled text layers, copy selected layers as clean Markdown, and map Markdown elements to your local text styles for brand consistency.


The plugin has three command launcher:

  1. Convert from Markdown: Paste or select Markdown text and generate Figma layers.
  2. Copy as Markdown: Export Figma text layers as ready-to-use Markdown.
  3. Match Styles: Map headings, lists, and links to your custom Figma text styles.


Includes live preview, dark/light theme support, and an intuitive manual copy UI for full clipboard compatibility.
plugins.tagline: Paste, copy, and map Markdown content to Figma text layers with style.

plugins.name: exportLang.json
plugins.description:
This Figma plugin, named exportLang, streamlines the process of extracting static texts from Figma designs and generating variable names for these texts through ChatGPT. The workflow is as follows:


Data Retrieval:


The plugin reads a JSON file, exportLang.json, where users store static texts from their Figma designs.

Variable Name Assignment:


For each static text in the JSON file, the plugin generates a unique variable name. For example, if there are three texts, the variable names might be text1, text2, and text3.

ChatGPT Interaction:


Using the generated variable names and their corresponding static texts, the plugin communicates with ChatGPT. It sends prompts to ChatGPT, requesting translation of the static texts into variable names.

Response Handling:


The plugin receives responses from ChatGPT, containing suggested variable names. These responses are associated with the original static texts.

Output in JSON Format:


The final output is a JSON file containing a mapping between variable names and their respective static texts. This structured JSON output facilitates easy integration into users' Figma projects.
plugins.tagline: exportLang.json

plugins.name: Button States Generator
plugins.description:
Enhance your design workflow with the Button States Generator and create consistent, accessible button components effortlessly.


Overview


The Button States Generator is a Figma plugin designed to streamline the creation of button components with multiple states: Default, Hover, Active, Focus, Selected, and Disabled.


Features


- Dynamic Button Creation: Generate button components with customizable dimensions, radius, paddings & colors

- State Variants: Automatically create and manage button states including Default, Hover, Active, Focus, Selected, and Disabled.

- Color Customization: Easily adjust each state colors, with options to randomize or reset to default.

- Contrast Checker: Built-in contrast checker ensures your design meets WCAG standards for accessibility.

- Icon Placement Options: Choose from multiple icon placement options (none, left, right, or icon-only) as a component property.


How to Use


Assuming you already have your button design ready:


1. Select button Frame: Start by selecting the frame of your button.

2. Customize Settings (optional): Use the plugin's UI to adjust dimensions, colors, and other settings if necessary.

3. Choose Icon Placement (optional): Select the icon placement option from the dropdown menu (none, left, right, or icon-only).

4. Generate Components: Click 'Create Component' to generate the button variants.


Note: This will not work if you select a pre-existing component. If your button is a component, detach it to convert it into a Frame.


Component Properties


The generated button component includes these useful properties:


- States: Choose between Default, Hover, Focus, Selected, and Disabled states

- Icon: Control icon placement (None, Left, Right, Only)

- Colors: Adjust text and background colors for each state

- Dimensions: Fine-tune sizing, radius and padding


Support


For any questions or support, please contact luc.hespel@gmail.com
plugins.tagline: Generate Button component with variants / states instantly

plugins.name: SVGReactify - SVG Component Creator
plugins.description:
Figma plugin that allows you to generate single/multiple SVG React & React Native components at once. Prepared as .eslint friendly and support parent color schemas with fill/stroke optimize


Features

  • Generate multiple components at once
  • Save each one or all as files
  • Expand props version
  • Typescript
  • With dimension or without dimensions (for responsive)
  • Icon
  • React Native
  • Ref
  • Memo
  • Prettier
  • Xmlns / Non-xmlns


To use SVGReactify

  1. Run the "SVGReactify - SVG Component Creator" plugin
  2. Highlight icon(s) in your Figma project
  3. Choose the settings of code you want to on left side.
  4. If you hightlight multiple items on project, you will see "Selected Icons" list. Choose one.
  5. Copy with top right side button of code preview icon for only 1 item.
  6. Or export all selected icon(s) as zip file


License

After 3 all days tried full functions, you'll be asked to enter your license key. Your license key will allow you or your team unlimited usage of SVGReactify.


To purchase a license for you or your team, please visit https://gurayyarar.gumroad.com/l/svg-reactify (Gumroad)

plugins.name: dixma
plugins.description:
What is Dixma?

Dixma is a 4-12 player storytelling party game in Figma, inspired by the the card game Dixit.

Video Walkthrough (YouTube)


Game Board Required:

https://www.figma.com/community/file/889925301071649823


Game Rules

Each round all players have 6 random cards. The storyteller for the round shares a clue about one of their cards, and every other player picks their card that best fits the storyteller's story. The cards are revealed and all the players (other than the storyteller) guess which card they think is the storyteller's.


Scoring

If ALL players find the Storyteller’s card,

or NO players find the Storyteller’s card:

Storyteller: 0 points 
Other players: 2 points  


If at least one player but not all players find the card: 

Storyteller: 3 points 
Players who have found the card: 3 points 


In either case:

+1 bonus point per vote on your card if you
 are not the storyteller, up to 3 per round.


GitHub: https://github.com/brettlyne/dixma

plugins.name: [NEW] Gleef - Translate and localize with AI
plugins.description:
Designed for teams to automate translation and streamline localization tasks directly in Figma.


Key Features

  1. Time-saving AI generation: Automate translation, key naming and searching, eliminating manual tasks and reduce the time spent on localization management.
  2. Workflow optimization: Maintain clarity and consistency by adhering to your project's naming conventions while preventing duplicate keys.
  3. Project organization: Easily track translated and pending keys to keep your localization projects on schedule.
  4. Code quality: Ensure formatting consistency across your localization files for polished and professional results.


How Gleef works

  1. Import your localization files: Quickly upload your existing localization files to get started.
  2. Select source language: Choose the source language for translations, typically the language used in your Figma designs.
  3. Choose screens / frames: Select one or multiple screens you're localizing within your Figma project.
  4. Adjust translations and keys: Maintain full control, adjust translations before exporting, allowing for fine-tuning of re-used and generated keys.
  5. Export ready files: Import the new keys into your preferred localization tool or copy-paste the updated locale file directly into your IDE.


Integrate Gleef into your Figma workflow, to significantly improve your localization process, save time and ensure consistency across your global product designs.


Whether you have questions, need a hand, or just want to share your feedback, don’t hesitate to give us a call – or send us a message if that’s more your style. We're excited to help you make the most of our new tool! +33 6 44 60 97 54

plugins.name: Spacing Token Generator
plugins.description:
🔧 What It Does

This Figma plugin helps you automatically generate spacing Tokens based on your preferred scale. Whether you're working with a base-4 or base-8 spacing system—or even a custom multiplier—this tool creates a clean, structured set of spacing tokens to integrate into your design system.



⚙️ How It Works


1. Choose Your Base Grid

Start by selecting your preferred spacing grid:

- 4pt scale (perfect for tighter systems)

- 8pt scale (industry standard for scalable design systems)

- Or choose the "Custom" option to set your own base multiplier (e.g., 5, 10, etc.)


2. Add Multipliers

Define the multipliers you want to generate tokens for.

You can:

- Use the default multipliers (e.g., 1x, 2x, 3x...)

- Add your own custom multipliers for more control over your spacing structure.



3. Generate Spacing Tokens

Click "Generate" and the plugin will automatically:

- Create a new variable collection called "Spacing"

- Generate a full set of iTokens (Figma variables) based on your chosen base and multipliers

- Structure them cleanly and consistently for immediate use across your components


🚀 Why Use It?

- ✅ Save time on repetitive token creation

- ✅ Maintain consistency across your design system

- ✅ Scale your UI spacing logic with precision

- ✅ Easily integrate into Design Tokens pipelines or handoff processes
plugins.tagline: Generate spacing Tokens instantly, right inside Figma.

plugins.name: Ecco Icon
plugins.description:
What is Ecco Icon?

Ecco Icon is a free, ever-expanding icon pack featuring both static and animated icons. This plugin allows designers to seamlessly add static versions of the icons to their Figma designs. When it’s time for development, animated Lottie versions can be downloaded from Ecco Icon website to bring projects to life.

For more customization, designers can also download the After Effects (.aep) files from Ecco Icon website to tweak colors or use them in mockups.


Is it really free?

Yes, it is! No paywalls or registration required. All icons, including animated versions, are free to use under the Creative Commons BY 4.0 license.

Thanks to your generous donations, the project continues to grow with even more icons and features!


This icon pack is created and maintained with love by Sajjad Dashti—graphic designer, product designer, and motion designer. For any inquiries, feel free to contact me at hi@sajjaddashti.ir.
plugins.tagline: Ecco Icon is a free pack with static and animated icons. Use this plugin to add them to your design.

For more customization, designers can also download the After Effects (.aep) files from Ecco Icon website to tweak colors or use them in mockups.


Is it really free?

Yes, it is! No paywalls or registration required. All icons, including animated versions, are free to use under the Creative Commons BY 4.0 license.

Thanks to your generous donations, the project continues to grow with even more icons and features!


This icon pack is created and maintained with love by Sajjad Dashti—graphic designer, product designer, and motion designer. For any inquiries, feel free to contact me at hi@sajjaddashti.ir.
119328.tagline: Ecco Icon is a free pack with static and animated icons. Use this plugin to add them to your design.

plugins.name: Numeric Tokens Generator
plugins.description:
Transform your design workflow with a comprehensive design system generator that creates and manages typography, spacing, border radius, and shadow systems - all powered by Figma variables.


Key Features:

📝 Complete Typography System

  1. Generate responsive typography scales with Material Design or Apple HIG guidelines
  2. Smart font pairing validation for optimal readability
  3. Automatic variable creation for font sizes and line heights
  4. Support for custom type scales and base sizes
  5. Responsive typography with desktop, tablet, and mobile variants (Pro)


↔️ Spacing System

  1. Create consistent spacing scales based on 4px or 8px grids
  2. Generate spacing variables for margins, padding, and layout
  3. Customizable number of spacing increments
  4. Visual preview of spacing values


⚪ Border Radius System

  1. Build systematic border radius scales
  2. Customizable base radius and increments
  3. Visual preview of radius values
  4. Perfect for maintaining consistent component shapes


🎭 Shadow System

  1. Create elevation-based shadow systems
  2. Customizable shadow properties (color, blur, spread)
  3. Visual angle control for consistent light sources
  4. Perfect for depth and hierarchy


📤 Export Options

  1. Web: CSS, SCSS, JSON
  2. Mobile: React Native, Flutter, Android XML, Swift
  3. Variables-first approach for easy updates
  4. Cross-platform consistency


📚 Auto-Documentation

  1. Generate visual documentation for your design system
  2. Automatic style guides with examples
  3. Clear naming conventions
  4. Easy team handoff


🔄 Smart Updates

  1. Detect existing settings
  2. Update system-wide changes through variables
  3. Maintain consistency across your design files


Perfect for design system creators, UI designers, and teams looking to maintain consistent, scalable design systems across web and mobile platforms.

plugins.name: Fonspector
plugins.description:
📝 Overview

Struggling to keep your typography consistent across frames without a design system in place? Fonspector makes it easy. This Figma plugin analyzes your project’s typography, offering instant insights to streamline your workflow. From refining a single frame to auditing an entire design system, Fonspector ensures consistency, identifies missing fonts and styles, and lets you navigate text elements effortlessly—all within your Figma workspace.


👉 Key Features

1. Comprehensive Frame Scanning

2. Multi-Font & Style Management

3. Detect Hidden Layers

4. Navigate to Text Elements


😤 How to Use

1. Select a Frame

2. Launch the Plugin

3. Initiate the Analysis by clicking the “Inspect” button

4. Explore Font Families

5. Navigate to Text Elements


📧 Support and Feedback

I'm excited to share Fonspector with the community as my first-ever plugin developed from scratch! Your feedback is invaluable for improving it. If you run into any issues, have suggestions, or need help, please reach out to me via email or leave a comment.

plugins.name: Chart Cleaner
plugins.description:
Drop your newly exported chart out of RAWGraphs and into Figma, then select it and run the plugin. Voila. Chart Cleaner duplicates the frame, cleans all the layers up, reorganizes everything, and then drops the new chart and legend (if you had one) into a new auto layout, ready for you to add your own copy and styles to. Everything remains editable as you'd normally expect.


Currently supports RAWGraphs SVGs, with Flourish coming soon. Currently cleans bar charts, small multiple bar charts, line graphs, and small multiple line graphs, with more coming soon.


Feedback more than welcome!

plugins.name: Figscreen - Screenshot Websites
plugins.description:
Figscreen – Website Screenshots in Figma


Figscreen is a Figma plugin that lets you import website screenshots directly into your canvas. It’s a tool built to simplify the process of collecting and organizing web references.


Features

  1. Bulk Import: Capture up to 25 websites at once
  2. High-Quality Screenshots: Supports Retina resolution
  3. Custom Sizes: Choose from preset device sizes or set custom dimensions (320px to 1920px)
  4. Auto Layout: Screenshots are arranged and labelled on the canvas
  5. Full-Page Support: Captures entire web pages, including lazy-loaded sections
  6. Responsive Views: Capture desktop, tablet, and mobile layouts


How to Use

  1. Paste one or more URLs (must include “https://”)
  2. Choose device types or set custom dimensions
  3. Click “Import Screenshots”
  4. Screenshots will appear on your canvas, organized and ready to use


Notes

  1. Works with public websites (no login required)
  2. Captures full pages, including dynamic content
  3. Upcoming features: option to hide banners, pop-ups, and chat widgets


If you have any questions, contact: support@figscreen.com

Found a bug? Report it here: figscreen.com/feedback
plugins.tagline: Capture, Import, Display – Up to 25 Sites at Once

plugins.name: Rastarizer
plugins.description:
Rastarizer simplifies your workflow by converting Figma frames, components, and instances into optimized raster images. Simply add "-x" to the name of any frame, component, or instance you want to include in the conversion. Your originals remain intact and are only hidden during the process - easily restored with a single click. Perfect for preparing slides for PDF export or creating static versions of your designs.


Features include:

  1. One-click conversion of frames, components, and instances to images
  2. Adjustable resolution (1x to 3x)
  3. Automatic size optimization
  4. Easy toggle between original and rasterized versions
  5. Progress tracking for batch processing
  6. Non-destructive workflow (originals preserved)


Disclaimer: This plugin is provided "as is" without any warranties. The developer is not responsible for any issues that may arise from its use. Users are advised to maintain backups of their work.
plugins.tagline: Convert frames, components, and instances to high-quality raster images with a single click

plugins.name: Dynogee Image Rendering API
plugins.description:
Dynogee is an easy and quick tool to expose your Figma designs as an API:


  1. ✨ Swap text and images with dynamic content
  2. 📐 Create pixel perfect copies of your design
  3. 🏎️ Supa-fast rendering times, render images on-the-fly
  4. 🚀 We thought of it: custom fonts, truncation, i18n, you name it


It’s like Figma's Export feature, but as an API. 💫


How to use the plugin


  1. Select a frame in Figma, and open the plugin
  2. Define layers for which you want to provide content via the API
  3. Create your template 🚀


Pro tip: Set a max height on text layers to enforce truncation. ✂️


Features


Full creative freedom

Use your brand fonts, colors and more to create high-fidelity dynamic images ✨


Fast rendering

Our backend is optimized to generate and distribute your images without long wait times. Often images are generated in as little as 200ms.


Handoff your templates to developers

Each template your create comes with it's own documentation and playground environment, making it trivial for your engineering team to make use of the image rendering API.


Contact


If you want to share your feedback, please reach out to us at support@dynogee.com.

plugins.name: Component Utility
plugins.description:
Component Utility

A utility plugin for effortlessly cloning and linking component sets.

Demo: https://youtu.be/j6dRKs2V8dQ


Clone Command

Clones the master component and links the selected instances to it.

  1. Select all the instances that need to be linked to new master component, along with the master component to be cloned.
  2. Run the clone command.
  3. A new master component would have been created and all the selected instances are linked to it.


Link Command

Links the selected instances to the designated master component. It can also links detached instances (or a frame containing similar child elements as the master component) and the designated master component.

  1. Select all the instances that need to be linked, along with the master component to which they should be linked to.
  2. Run the link command.
plugins.tagline: A utility plugin for effortlessly cloning and linking component sets.

plugins.name: LinguaSync
plugins.description:
LinguaSync is in Beta test for limted user.


Features

  1. Context-Aware Translation: By leveraging the strengths of the AI model, which excels at understanding context, this plugin can accurately translate specifications and service screens written in various languages including English, Japanese, Vietnamese, and Korean.
  2. One-Click Translation: To save you from the tedious process of copying and pasting text, we have implemented a feature that allows users to directly select the area within Figma for one-click translation.
  3. Replace Mode: The plugin is equipped with the ability to translate while retaining the existing Figma text format into the desired multilingual language. If you wish, you can simultaneously view the input and output languages without overwriting.
plugins.tagline: Unlock multilingual superpowers with our plugin, using AI to translate and understand context!

plugins.name: Embedded Wizard Connect for Figma
plugins.description:
Export Figma Designs to Embedded Wizard Studio

Embedded Wizard Connect for Figma simplifies the workflow between designers and embedded developers. Instead of recreating designs from scratch in Embedded Wizard Studio, you can now start with GUI layouts from Figma and bring the design to life more quickly.


Benefits:

-Template-free flexibility: Designers can work freely in Figma without being restricted to rigid templates.

-Simplified Workflow: Embedded Wizard converts Figma designs into implementable code suited for embedded systems, eliminating manual efforts and reducing development time.

-Uncomplicated Design Updates: Save time by reimporting updated Figma Designs with just a few clicks


Getting started:

Check out the full documentation for best practices

Get to know Embedded Wizard on our website.


About Embedded Wizard:

Embedded Wizard is TARA Systems’ award-winning solution for developing embedded graphical user interfaces (GUIs).

accepted.name: TARA Systems GmbH
accepted.description: TARA Systems is an independent software company. Embedded Wizard is its award-winning solution for creating graphical user interfaces for embedded systems.

plugins.tagline: Bring your creativity pixel prefect to your embedded device

plugins.name: Caravage
plugins.description:
Check easily your design contrast accessibility with the 3.0 Web Content Accessibility Guidelines.


About

Caravage allows you to check easily your design contrast accessibility with the 3.0 Web Content Accessibility Guidelines.


You can either select individually any text layer or scan a selection and the plugin will automatically give you for each text:

  1. The colour(s) of the text.
  2. The colour(s) of the background directly behind the text.
  3. The font size and weight of the text.
  4. The contrast value based on WCAG 3.0 (Web Content Accessibility Guidelines) and the new colour contrast method called APCA (Accessible Perceptual Contrast Algorithm).
  5. The minimum contrast value provided by the APCA contrast look up table.


Credits

  1. This plugin was inspired by another plugin called Contrast.
  2. This plugin use the Accessible Perceptual Contrast Algorithm by Andrew Somers.
  3. This plugin use RGBQuant to analyze the colour(s) of the selected text and the background behind it.
  4. This plugin use Figma Plugin DS, a lightweight UI library.
plugins.tagline: Check easily your design contrast accessibility with the 3.0 Web Content Accessibility Guidelines

plugins.name: Xerus
plugins.description:
Xerus helps you to organize the texts of your designs while having powerful tools to automate your text workflow. It synchronizes your figma text and your Airtable database.


Xerus is for free! I am glad I can contribute to the community. Airtable has a free version too, that supports a maximum of text entries, please check their price plan to see which option is best for you.


Getting started

There are several ways to use Xerus in your project. In this website, I explain you step by step how to set up Xerus for your project. Do you want to change the language of all text in your design? Do you want to update all instances of a text? Xerus can do it for you.


Features

  • Text synchronization between Airtable database and Figma.
  • Multiple layer synchronization pointing to the same database entry.
  • Single layer synchronization.
  • Multiple database connections


Incoming features

Do you have suggestions to improve Xerus? Contact me!

  • Import/Export of PO files.
  • Support complex Airtable fields


Updates

  • 1.0: first release
  • 2.0: fixed bug with airtable token and improved the error messaging.
  • 3.0: added support texts with breaklines
plugins.tagline: Xerus allows you to manage large amount of texts in your designs.

plugins.name: Syncfusion® Design Tokens
plugins.description:
Syncfusion® Design Tokens: The Premier Figma Plugin for Seamless Theme Generation

The Syncfusion® Design Tokens plugin offers a professional and efficient solution for translating style changes made in Figma into custom Syncfusion® themes, ready to be applied in your applications. This tool eliminates the need for manual style transfers, streamlining the design-to-development workflow.


Key Features:

  1. Custom Theme Creation: Tailor Syncfusion® component styles in Figma to align with your unique brand identity.
  2. Effortless Token Export: Export design tokens directly from Figma with ease.
  3. Seamless Integration: Utilize the exported tokens to create custom themes in Theme Studio and implement them in your applications.


How It Works:

This streamlined process involves three simple steps:

1.Customize Your Theme

Modify the styles of Syncfusion® components within Figma to reflect your brand’s identity and design requirements.

2.Export Design Tokens

Leverage the Syncfusion® Design Tokens plugin to export your custom design tokens. The plugin generates two essential files:

  1. css-variables.css: This file contains CSS variables for both light and dark themes, derived directly from your Figma designs. Import it into your application alongside the component styles to implement your custom designs. For detailed usage, refer to the CSS Variables Documentation.
  2. -tokens.json: This JSON file (e.g., material3-tokens.json) includes style variables and values compatible with Theme Studio for further customization.

3. Tokens to Theme Files

This <theme-name>-tokens.json file, prefixed with the corresponding theme name, can be imported into Theme Studio for further customization. After processing in Theme Studio, you can download the updated styles file and integrate it into your application, bringing your custom themes to life.


Benefits:

  1. Efficiency: Minimize manual tasks and reduce errors by automating the design-to-development process.
  2. Consistency: Ensure a uniform appearance across your applications by aligning design and development seamlessly.
  3. Scalability: Easily adapt and reuse custom themes across multiple projects.


With the Syncfusion® Design Tokens plugin, you can bridge the gap between design and development, creating cohesive and visually stunning user experiences with ease.

plugins.tagline: Accelerate Your Workflow by Exporting Design Tokens Directly  to Code
